intro: Arabis segetalis, commonly known as field chickweed, is a low-growing annual plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of smooth, spoon-shaped leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in fields, gardens, and along roadsides. Arabis segetalis is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed soils.
